3.res: When Barack Obama was six years old, he and his mother moved to Indonesia to join his step-father; from age six to ten, he attended local Indonesian-language schools:St. Francis of Assisi Catholic Elementary School for two years and State Elementary School Menteng 01 for one and a half years, supplemented by English-language Calvert School homeschooling by his mother. As a result of those four years in Jakarta, he was able to speak Indonesian fluently as a child.During his time in Indonesia, Obama's step-father taught him to be resilient and gave him "a pretty hardheaded assessment of how the world works".
